page.title: 08DUAL CARRIAGEWAY IN RAGLAN
page.content: {DUAL CARRIAGEWAY RAGLAN} The village of Raglan is situated in the heart of the beautiful Welsh border country.It is within easy driving distance of the historic market town of Monmouth,Abergavenny, Usk and Chepstow.The busy A40 dual carriageway passes close by the village and provides good access to the Midlands and South Wales,whilst the Severn Bridge brings Bristol, London and the South coast within easy reach.The dual carriageway extends eighteen miles south to link up with the M4 motorway at the Coldra roundabout in Newport and 18 miles North to join the M50 motorway at Ross on Wye.The heads of the valley road from Abergavenny is also linked near Raglan village.
